Every few minutes, a blast from a passing pooch. I had a vision of being kept up all night with a serenade, but that never happened. Our room was quiet at night. Luck?

Great San Simeon Location, Loved the Beachfront!!
reviews.text: This is a nice place. To make it better, I might limit the dog rooms to a certain part of the motel. Just a thought.

We stayed one night and wished we had time to stay longer. We had two ocean front rooms with balconies that looked out over the Pacific Ocean. The sound of the waves as we slept was incredible. The wood burning stove in the room made it cozy since it gets rather cool at night. The room was spotless. I particularly appreciated the heat lamp in the bathroom which made it toasty in the morning for a shower. The hotel is in a wonderful location -- a couple miles from Hearst Castle and right near a delightful town called Cambria which has lots of interesting little shops and restaurants. The next time we visit Hearst Castle, we will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: What a View!

reviews.text: Recently a good friend and I were planning a birthday trip down the California coast Hwy 1. Our first stop was San Simeon, CA; I read lots of different lodging reviews for the area, including tripadvisor. I ended up following the advice and recommendations of the reviews. And boy, they were spot on for this property; it's a step up from the ‘average’ Best Western experience. Check-in/out was a breeze; the staff was friendly and informative. Our room was immaculately clean and we were provided with a very nice selection of shower amenities. The hotel is located on a beautiful stretch of beach. In the evenings, the hotel staff stocks and lights 3 firepits located on the lawn overlooking the ocean. My friend and I sat there for a long time talking, enjoying the full moon and stars, keeping warm on a chilly night. The adjacent restaurant offered good quality food, and attentive service. I recommend this place for anyone looking to relax for a day or two. On our drive down the coast the next morning, we stopped in Cambria, CA what a wonderful town. Don't miss the local art galleries, the magic store on main street (the Village Wizard) and the gas station has great gifts for sale.
reviews.title: Wonderful Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a surprise!!! We were on Day 2 of our drive down the Pacific Coast Highway from San Francisco to Los Angeles. We were scheduled to stop in San Luis Obispo further south, but with so much stopping to take pictures (and driving reallly slow on the very winding and narrow US 1), this particular leg of the trip took longer than expected. Tired, but interested in taking the tour of the Hearst Castle the following day, we pulled into this Best Western at 6pm and hoped for the best. Not having a reservation we kept our fingers crossed that there would be a room available and to our delight, we were obliged with a second floor room with ocean view. Check-in was quick and the lady behind the desk was very helpful in letting us know all the services the hotel had to offer.
reviews.title: Best kept seceret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never having stayed in a Best Western hotel before, we weren't sure what to expect. Well, we couldn't have been more pleased. The room was neat and clean with a balcony that looked straight out to the ocean. The pool/jacuzzi was right below our windows, and had it been warmer, it may have gotten a little noisy, but this being April and the temperature hovering at 60 degrees, the pool was empty and quiet. There were two fresh robes in the room to sink into and a great toletries basket to fresher up with (it even had nail polish remover pads which were just what I needed after two days of peeling laquer off my fingernails). The mini bar was chock full of drinks and snacks at completely reasonable prices. The coffeemaker also came in handy in the morning. All other regular amenities were available...ironing board, hair dryer, safe, extra pillow/blanker/towels. The tub was huge (unlike most newer hotel) so I was able to sink into a nice hot bath after dinner. There was even a pair of binoculars in the room to gaze out in the distance with. And what a treat to find a real fireplace in the room with synthetic wood logs to burn! The hotel leaves a little packet of starter fluid and newspaper in the fireplace, so it was very easy to get things going.
reviews.title: Wow!
terrific
reviews.text: Once we settled in, we had a relaxing and tasty dinner in the Cavalier restaurant which had quite the expansive and reasonably priced menu. Wait staff was very attentive and the food was delicious. It was fun to look around the restaurant and guess how many others were doing the same road trip we were taking. At sunset the hotel lights a couple of bonfires on the beach and sets out chairs, so if you're with a group or just looking to socialize with other hotel guests, it's a delight. We chose instead to retreat back to our room and fall asleep to the sounds of the ocean crashing against the beach.

Check-out in the morning couldn't have been easier...the bill was on the doorknob and if everything was okay, all you had to do was leave the keys in the room. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a quick stopover - our stay was totally unexpected but well worth the money!
reviews.title: Best Western Cavalier was the best!

reviews.text: I do not have the words to describe the hotel. The view of the ocean, the room, the service of the employees. We spent only one night, but I believe that we could spend several days in this hotel with my fiancèe. I recommend it whoever to be in a warm and very pretty place. I recommend the room with ocean view and fireplace.
reviews.title: A Gem on the Pacific!
